segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 10
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 10

segments.pli: 5. Akkosavagga
segments.en: 5. Abuse

segments.pli: 44. Kusinārasutta
segments.en: 44. At Kusināra

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā kusinārāyaṃ viharati baliharaṇe vanasaṇḍe.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Kusināra, in the Forest of Offerings.

segments.pli: Tatra kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi:
segments.en: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants,

segments.pli: “bhikkhavo”ti.
segments.en: “Mendicants!”

segments.pli: “Bhadante”ti te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṃ.
segments.en: “Venerable sir,” they replied.

segments.pli: Bhagavā etadavoca:
segments.en: The Buddha said this:

segments.pli: “Codakena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā paraṃ codetukāmena pañca dhamme ajjhattaṃ paccavekkhitvā pañca dhamme ajjhattaṃ upaṭṭhāpetvā paro codetabbo.
segments.en: “Mendicants, a mendicant who wants to accuse another should first check five things in themselves and establish five things in themselves.

segments.pli: Katame pañca dhammā ajjhattaṃ paccavekkhitabbā?
segments.en: What five things should they check in themselves?

segments.pli: Codakena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā paraṃ codetukāmena evaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ:
segments.en: A mendicant who wants to accuse another should check this:

segments.pli: ‘parisuddhakāyasamācāro nu khomhi, parisuddhenamhi kāyasamācārena samannāgato acchiddena appaṭimaṃsena.
segments.en: ‘Is my bodily behavior pure? Do I have pure bodily behavior that is impeccable and irreproachable?

segments.pli: Saṃvijjati nu kho me eso dhammo udāhu no’ti?
segments.en: Is this thing found in me or not?’

segments.pli: No ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhu parisuddhakāyasamācāro hoti parisuddhena kāyasamācārena samannāgato acchiddena appaṭimaṃsena, tassa bhavanti vattāro:
segments.en: If it’s not, there will be people who say:

segments.pli: ‘iṅgha tāva āyasmā kāyikaṃ sikkhassū’ti, itissa bhavanti vattāro.
segments.en: ‘Come on, venerable, train your own bodily behavior first.’

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, codakena bhikkhunā paraṃ codetukāmena evaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ:
segments.en: Furthermore, a mendicant who wants to accuse another should check this:

segments.pli: ‘parisuddhavacīsamācāro nu khomhi, parisuddhenamhi vacīsamācārena samannāgato acchiddena appaṭimaṃsena.
segments.en: ‘Is my verbal behavior pure? Do I have pure verbal behavior that is impeccable and irreproachable?

segments.pli: Saṃvijjati nu kho me eso dhammo udāhu no’ti?
segments.en: Is this thing found in me or not?’

segments.pli: No ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhu parisuddhavacīsamācāro hoti parisuddhena vacīsamācārena samannāgato acchiddena appaṭimaṃsena, tassa bhavanti vattāro:
segments.en: If it’s not, there will be people who say:

segments.pli: ‘iṅgha tāva āyasmā vācasikaṃ sikkhassū’ti, itissa bhavanti vattāro.
segments.en: ‘Come on, venerable, train your own verbal behavior first.’

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, codakena bhikkhunā paraṃ codetukāmena evaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ:
segments.en: Furthermore, a mendicant who wants to accuse another should check this:

segments.pli: ‘mettaṃ nu kho me cittaṃ paccupaṭṭhitaṃ sabrahmacārīsu anāghātaṃ.
segments.en: ‘Is my heart established in love for my spiritual companions, without resentment?

segments.pli: Saṃvijjati nu kho me eso dhammo udāhu no’ti?
segments.en: Is this thing found in me or not?’

segments.pli: No ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno mettaṃ cittaṃ paccupaṭṭhitaṃ hoti sabrahmacārīsu anāghātaṃ, tassa bhavanti vattāro:
segments.en: If it’s not, there will be people who say:

segments.pli: ‘iṅgha tāva āyasmā sabrahmacārīsu mettaṃ cittaṃ upaṭṭhāpehī’ti, itissa bhavanti vattāro.
segments.en: ‘Come on, venerable, establish your heart in love for your spiritual companions first.’

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, codakena bhikkhunā paraṃ codetukāmena evaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ:
segments.en: Furthermore, a mendicant who wants to accuse another should check this:

segments.pli: ‘bahussuto nu khomhi sutadharo sutasannicayo, ye te dhammā ādikalyāṇā majjhekalyāṇā pariyosānakalyāṇā sātthaṃ sabyañjanaṃ kevalaparipuṇṇaṃ parisuddhaṃ brahmacariyaṃ abhivadanti, tathārūpā me dhammā bahussutā honti dhātā vacasā paricitā manasānupekkhitā diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhā.
segments.en: ‘Am I very learned, remembering and keeping what I’ve learned? These teachings are good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, meaningful and well-phrased, describing a spiritual practice that’s entirely full and pure. Am I very learned in such teachings, remembering them, reinforcing them by recitation, mentally scrutinizing them, and comprehending them theoretically?

segments.pli: Saṃvijjati nu kho me eso dhammo udāhu no’ti?
segments.en: Is this thing found in me or not?’

segments.pli: No ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhu bahussuto hoti sutadharo sutasannicayo, ye te dhammā ādikalyāṇā majjhekalyāṇā pariyosānakalyāṇā sātthaṃ sabyañjanaṃ kevalaparipuṇṇaṃ parisuddhaṃ brahmacariyaṃ abhivadanti, tathārūpāssa dhammā bahussutā honti dhātā vacasā paricitā manasānupekkhitā diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhā, tassa bhavanti vattāro:
segments.en: If it’s not, there will be people who say:

segments.pli: ‘iṅgha tāva āyasmā āgamaṃ pariyāpuṇassū’ti, itissa bhavanti vattāro.
segments.en: ‘Come on, venerable, memorize the scriptures first.’

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, codakena bhikkhunā paraṃ codetukāmena evaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ:
segments.en: Furthermore, a mendicant who wants to accuse another should check this:

segments.pli: ‘ubhayāni kho pana me pātimokkhāni vitthārena svāgatāni honti suvibhattāni suppavattīni suvinicchitāni suttaso anubyañjanaso.
segments.en: ‘Have both monastic codes been passed down to me in detail, well analyzed, well mastered, and well judged in both the rules and accompanying material?

segments.pli: Saṃvijjati nu kho me eso dhammo udāhu no’ti?
segments.en: Is this thing found in me or not?’

segments.pli: No ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno ubhayāni pātimokkhāni vitthārena svāgatāni honti suvibhattāni suppavattīni suvinicchitāni suttaso anubyañjanaso, ‘idaṃ panāyasmā, kattha vuttaṃ bhagavatā’ti, iti puṭṭho na sampāyissati.
segments.en: If it’s not, there will be people who say:

segments.pli: Tassa bhavanti vattāro:
‘iṅgha tāva āyasmā vinayaṃ sikkhassū’ti, itissa bhavanti vattāro.
segments.en: ‘Come on, venerable, train in the code of conduct first.’

segments.pli: Ime pañca dhammā ajjhattaṃ paccavekkhitabbā.
segments.en: These are the five things they should check in themselves.

segments.pli: Katame pañca dhammā ajjhattaṃ upaṭṭhāpetabbā?
segments.en: What five things should they establish in themselves?

segments.pli: ‘Kālena vakkhāmi, no akālena;
segments.en: ‘I will speak at the right time, not at the wrong time.

segments.pli: bhūtena vakkhāmi, no abhūtena;
segments.en: I will speak truthfully, not falsely.

segments.pli: saṇhena vakkhāmi, no pharusena;
segments.en: I will speak gently, not harshly.

segments.pli: atthasaṃhitena vakkhāmi, no anatthasaṃhitena;
segments.en: I will speak beneficially, not harmfully.

segments.pli: mettacitto vakkhāmi, no dosantaro’ti—
segments.en: I will speak lovingly, not from secret hate.’

segments.pli: ime pañca dhammā ajjhattaṃ upaṭṭhāpetabbā.
segments.en: These are the five things they should establish in themselves.

segments.pli: Codakena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā paraṃ codetukāmena ime pañca dhamme ajjhattaṃ paccavekkhitvā ime pañca dhamme ajjhattaṃ upaṭṭhāpetvā paro codetabbo”ti.
segments.en: A mendicant who wants to accuse another should first check these five things in themselves and establish these five things in themselves.”

segments.pli: Catutthaṃ.

sections.title: At one time the Buddha was staying near Kusināra,…

suttaplex.blurb: A mendicant who wishes to admonish another should first reflect on five things in themselves and establish a further five.
